source_sentence: 中阿含經卷第三十四
translation: Middle Length Āgama Sutras, Volume 34

source_sentence: 東晉罽賓三藏瞿曇僧伽提婆譯
translation: Gautama Saṃghadeva Translation of the Tripiṭaka of Kāśmīra, Eastern Jin

source_sentence: （一三六）大品商人求財經第二十(第三念誦)
translation: (136) The Twentieth (Third Recitation) of the Great Chapter on Seeking Financial Rewards by Merchants

source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「乃往昔時，閻浮洲中諸商人等皆共集會在賈客堂，而作是念：『我等寧可乘海裝船，入大海中取財寶來，以供家用。』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "Once upon a time, merchants from Jambudvīpa gathered together in a caravanserai and thought, 'We'd better take a ship out to sea and go into the ocean to get treasure for our families.'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『諸賢入海，不可豫知安隱、不安隱，我等寧可各各備辦浮海之具，謂羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰。』
translation: Again, they thought, 'Good men, you can't know for sure whether you're safe or not when you go to sea; we might each prepare a floating outfit, which would be an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft.'

source_sentence: 彼於後時各各備辦浮海之具，羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，便入大海。
translation: Then they each prepared a floating outfit, an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft, and they entered the ocean.

source_sentence: 彼在海中為摩竭魚王破壞其船，彼商人等各各自乘浮海之具，羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，浮向諸方。
translation: When they were in the middle of the ocean, the king of the Maghaswas destroyed his ship, and the merchants each took a floating implement, an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a barge, and floated off to various directions.

source_sentence: 「爾時，海東大風卒起，吹諸商人至海西岸，彼中逢見諸女人輩，極妙端正，一切嚴具以飾其身。
translation: "At the time, a great wind suddenly arose on the east side of the ocean and blew the merchants to the west shore of the ocean, where they met a group of women who were extremely beautiful and upright, adorned with all the finery that decorated their bodies.

source_sentence: 彼女見已，便作是語：『善來，諸賢！
translation: When the women saw them, they said, 'Good, good men!

source_sentence: 快來，諸賢！
translation: Come quickly, good men!

source_sentence: 此間極樂最妙好處，園觀浴池、坐臥處所、林木蓊欝，多有錢財、金銀、水精、琉璃、摩尼、真珠、碧玉、白珂、車璩、珊瑚、虎珀、馬瑙、瑇瑁、赤石、旋珠，盡與諸賢，當與我等共相娛樂，莫令閻浮洲商人南行，乃至於夢。』
translation: Here in this most wonderful of places, there are gardens, baths, sitting and sleeping places, and groves of trees, and there's a lot of money, gold, silver, aqua, lapis lazuli, maṇi, genuine pearls, jasper, white gold, chariot, coral, tiger pearls, coral, horse agate, jackass, red stone, and swirling pearls, all of which should be shared with us, good men, so don't let the merchants of Jambudvīpa travel southward, even in a dream.'

source_sentence: 彼商人等皆與婦人共相娛樂。
translation: Those merchants and others all entertain themselves with women.

source_sentence: 彼商人等因共婦人合會，生男或復生女。
translation: As a result of their union with a woman, those merchants gave birth to a boy or another girl.

source_sentence: 彼於後時，閻浮洲有一智慧商人獨住靜處，而作是念：『以何等故？
translation: At the time, there was a wise merchant on Jambudvīpa who was staying alone in a quiet place and thought, 'What's the reason?'

source_sentence: 此婦人輩制於我等不令南行耶？
translation: Do these women keep us from traveling south?

source_sentence: 我寧可伺共居婦人，知彼眠已，安徐而起，當竊南行。』
translation: I would rather wait for the woman living with me, knowing that she's sleeping and rising quietly, and then steal her as she travels south.'

source_sentence: 「彼閻浮洲一智慧商人則於後，伺共居婦人，知彼眠已，安徐而起，即竊南行。
translation: "That wise merchant from Jambudvīpa then looked behind him and saw the woman living with him, knew she was asleep, got up quietly, and stole her as he headed south.

source_sentence: 彼閻浮洲一智慧商人既南行已，遙聞大音高聲喚叫，眾多人聲啼哭懊惱，喚父呼母，呼喚妻子及諸愛念親親朋友，好閻浮洲安隱快樂，不復得見。
translation: After that wise merchant from Jambudvīpa traveled south, he heard a loud, distant voice calling out, and a multitude of people were wailing and distressed, calling for their fathers and mothers, wives and beloved relatives and friends, and the good people of Jambudvīpa were so peaceful and happy that they could no longer be seen.

source_sentence: 彼商人聞已，極大恐怖，身毛皆竪，莫令人及非人觸嬈我者。
translation: When that merchant heard it, he became terrified and his hair stood on end, so he couldn't allow anyone or non-person to touch or disturb him.

source_sentence: 於是，閻浮洲一智慧商人自制恐怖，復進南行。
translation: Then, a wise merchant from Jambudvīpa restrained himself from becoming frightened and resumed his journey south.

source_sentence: 彼閻浮洲一智慧商人進行南已，忽見東邊有大鐵城，見已，遍觀不見其門，乃至可容猫子出處。
translation: After that wise merchant from Jambudvīpa traveled south, he suddenly saw a large iron city to the east, and when he saw it, he looked around and couldn't see its entrance, even down to the point where a cat could exit.

source_sentence: 「彼閻浮洲一智慧商人見鐵城北有大叢樹，即往至彼大叢樹所，安徐緣上，上已，問彼大眾人曰：『諸賢！
translation: "When that wise merchant from Jambudvīpa saw a large grove of trees to the north of the iron city, he went to that large grove, took his ease, and got up there.

source_sentence: 汝等何故，啼哭懊惱，喚父呼母，呼喚妻子及諸愛念親親朋友？
translation: Why do you lament and agitate, calling to your father and mother, to your wife and to those who long for you and your friends?

source_sentence: 好閻浮洲安隱快樂，不復得見耶？』
translation: Is Jambudvīpa so peaceful and happy that you can't see it again?'

source_sentence: 時，大眾人便答彼曰：『賢者！
translation: The crowd then answered them, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 我等是閻浮洲諸商人也，皆共集會在賈客堂，而作是念：「我等寧可乘海裝船，入大海中取財寶來以供家用。」
translation: We are merchants from Jambudvīpa who have gathered here in the Jagatana Hall and thought, "We'd better take a ship out to sea and go into the ocean to get some treasure for our families."

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: "Good man!

source_sentence: 我等復作是念：「諸賢！
translation: Again, we thought, "Good men!

source_sentence: 我等入海，不可豫知安隱、不安隱，我等寧可各各備辦浮海之具，謂羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰。」
translation: When we enter the sea, we can't foresee whether we'll be safe or not, but we should each prepare our own equipment for floating in the sea, which is an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft."

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: "Good man!

source_sentence: 我於後時各各備辦浮海之具，謂羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，便入大海。
translation: At some point later, I prepared each of these things to float in the ocean, which are an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft, and then I entered the ocean.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等在海中，為摩竭魚王破壞其船。
translation: We were in the ocean when King Māgāra destroyed his boat.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等商人各各自乘浮海之具，羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，浮向諸方。
translation: We merchants each took a floating boat, an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft, and we floated off to various places.

source_sentence: 爾時，海東大風卒起，吹我等商人至海西岸，彼中逢見諸女人輩，極妙端正，一切嚴具以飾其身。
translation: At the time, a great wind arose on the east side of the ocean and blew us merchants to the west shore of the ocean, where we met a group of women who were extremely beautiful and upright, adorned with all the finery for their bodies.

source_sentence: 彼女見已，便作是語：「善來，諸賢！
translation: When the women saw them, they said, "Good, good men!

source_sentence: 快來，諸賢！
translation: Come quickly, good men!

source_sentence: 此間極樂最妙好處，園觀浴池、坐臥處所、林木蓊欝，多有錢財、金銀、水精、琉璃、摩尼、真珠、碧玉、白珂、車璩、珊瑚、虎珀、馬瑙、瑇瑁、赤石、旋珠，盡與諸賢，當與我等共相娛樂，莫令閻浮洲商人南行，乃至於夢。」
translation: Here in this most wonderful place of ultimate bliss are gardens, bathing pools, places to sit and lay, and groves of trees, where there's lots of money, gold, silver, water spirits, lapis lazuli, maṇi, genuine pearls, jasper, white gold, chariot, coral, tiger pearl, coral, horse agate, jackass, red stone, and swirling pearls, all of which should be given to you, good men, to entertain us together so that merchants from Jambudvīpa don't travel southward, even in a dream."

source_sentence: 「『賢者！
translation: "'Good man!

source_sentence: 我等與彼婦人共相娛樂。
translation: "We entertain ourselves with that woman together.

source_sentence: 我等因共婦人合會，生男或復生女。
translation: As a result of our union with that woman, a boy or another girl was born.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 若彼婦人不聞閻浮洲餘諸商人在於海中，為摩竭魚王破壞船者，則與我等共相娛樂。
translation: If that woman didn't hear that the other merchants of Jambudvīpa were in the ocean and that King Māgāra had destroyed their boat, then she would have shared our amusement.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 若彼婦人聞閻浮洲有諸商人在於海中，為摩竭魚王破壞船者，便食我等，極遭逼迫。
translation: "If those women hear that there are merchants in the ocean on Jambudvīpa who are destroying their boats for King Māgāra, they'll eat us and subject us to extreme persecution.

source_sentence: 若食人時，有餘髮毛及爪齒者，彼婦人等盡取食之。
translation: If there's any hair, nails, or teeth left when they eat someone, those women will take them and eat them all.

source_sentence: 若食人時，有血渧地，彼婦人等便以手爪掘地深四寸，取而食之。
translation: If there's blood on the ground when they eat someone, those women dig their hands and claws into the ground four inches deep, take it, and eat it.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 當知我等閻浮洲商人本有五百人，於中已噉二百五十，餘有二百五十，今皆在此大鐵城中。
translation: You should know that there were originally 500 of us merchants from Jambudvīpa, of whom 250 have already been devoured and the remaining 250 are now in this great iron city.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 汝莫信彼婦人語，彼非真人，是羅剎鬼耳。』
translation: Don't believe that woman's words; she's not a real person, she's a Rāṣṭrapāla ghost.'

source_sentence: 「於是，閻浮洲一智慧商人於大叢樹安徐下已，復道而還彼婦人所本共居處，知彼婦人故眠未寤，即於其夜，彼閻浮洲一智慧商人速往至彼閻浮洲諸商人所，便作是語：『汝等共來！
translation: "After descending quietly from the great grove, that wise merchant from Jambudvīpa returned to the woman's previous dwelling place, knowing that she had been asleep and hadn't awakened.

source_sentence: 當至靜處，汝各獨往，勿將兒去，當共在彼，密有所論。』
translation: You will go to a quiet place, go alone, don't leave your children, and stay there together to discuss it in detail.'

source_sentence: 彼閻浮洲諸商人等共至靜處，各自獨去，不將兒息。
translation: The merchants of Jambudvīpa went to a quiet place together, each left alone, and didn't leave their children to rest.

source_sentence: 「於是，閻浮洲一智慧商人語曰：『諸商人！
translation: "Then, a wise merchant on Jambudvīpa said, 'Merchants!

source_sentence: 我則獨住於安靜處，而作是念：「以何等故？
translation: I then stand alone in my quiet place and think, "What is the reason?

source_sentence: 此婦人輩制於我等不令南行耶？
translation: Do these women keep us from traveling south?

source_sentence: 我寧可伺共居婦人，知彼眠已，安徐而起，當竊南行。」
translation: I'd better wait for the woman living with me, knowing that she's sleeping, and then I'll get up quietly and steal her southward."

source_sentence: 於是，我便伺共居婦人，知彼眠已，我安徐起，即竊南行。
translation: So I then looked for the woman I was living with, and knowing that she was asleep, I quietly got up and stole my way south.

source_sentence: 我南行已，遙聞大音高聲喚叫，眾多人聲啼哭懊惱，喚父呼母，呼喚妻子及諸愛念親親朋友，好閻浮洲安隱快樂，不復得見。
translation: As I traveled south, I heard a great, loud voice calling out, and a multitude of voices wailing and distressed, calling for fathers and mothers, wives and beloved relatives and friends, and the peaceful and joyous state of Jambudvīpa, which can no longer be seen.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，極大恐怖，身毛皆竪，莫令人及非人觸嬈我者。
translation: When I heard that, I was so terrified that my hair stood on end, and I couldn't allow anyone or non-person to touch and disturb me.

source_sentence: 於是，我便自制恐怖，復進南行，進南行已，忽見東邊有大鐵城，見已，遍觀不見其門，乃至可容猫子出處。
translation: After walking south, I suddenly saw a large iron fortress to the east, and when I saw it, I looked around and couldn't see its entrance, even down to the point where a cat could get out.

source_sentence: 「『我復見於大鐵城北有大叢樹，即往至彼大叢樹所，安徐緣上，上已，問彼大眾人曰：「諸賢！
translation: "'Again, I saw a large grove of trees to the north of the great iron city, so I went over to that large grove of trees, took my time getting up there, and when I got up there, I asked the crowd, "Good men!

source_sentence: 汝等何故，啼哭懊惱，喚父呼母，呼喚妻子及諸愛念親親朋友？
translation: Why do you lament and agitate, calling to your father and mother, to your wife and to those who long for you and your friends?

source_sentence: 好閻浮洲安隱快樂，不復得見耶？」
translation: Is Jambudvīpa so peaceful and happy that you can't see it again?"

source_sentence: 彼大眾人而答我曰：「賢者！
translation: The great multitude of them answered me, "Good man!

source_sentence: 我等是閻浮洲諸商人，皆共集會在賈客堂，而作是念：『我等寧可乘海裝船，入大海中取財寶來以供家用。』
translation: We, the merchants of Jambudvīpa, all gathered together in the Chakra Hall and thought, 'We'd better take a ship out to sea and go into the ocean to get some treasure for our families.'

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等復作是念：『諸賢！
translation: Again, we thought, 'Good men!

source_sentence: 我等入海，不可豫知安隱、不安隱，我等寧可各各備辦浮海之具，謂羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰。』
translation: When we enter the sea, we can't foresee whether we'll be safe or not, but we might as well each prepare our own gear for floating in the sea, which is an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft.'

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等後時各各備辦浮海之具，謂羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，便入大海。
translation: Later, we each prepared a floating outfit, which was an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft, and then we entered the ocean.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等在海中，為摩竭魚王破壞其船。
translation: We were in the ocean when King Māgāra destroyed his boat.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等商人各各自乘浮海之具，羖羊皮囊、大瓠、押栰，浮向諸方。
translation: We merchants each took a floating boat, an ewe's skin, a large gourd, and a raft, and we floated off to various places.

source_sentence: 爾時，海東大風卒起，吹我等商人至海西岸，彼中逢見諸女人輩，極妙端正，一切嚴具以飾其身，彼女見已，便作是語：『善來，諸賢！
translation: At the time, a great wind arose on the east side of the ocean and blew us merchants to the west shore of the ocean, where we met a group of women who were extremely beautiful and upright, adorned with all the finery for their bodies, and when they saw them, they said, 'Good, good men!

source_sentence: 快來，諸賢！
translation: Come quickly, good men!

source_sentence: 此間極樂最妙好處，園觀浴池、坐臥處所、林木蓊欝，多有錢財、金銀、水精、琉璃、摩尼、真珠、碧玉、白珂、車璩、珊瑚、虎珀、馬瑙、瑇瑁、赤石、旋珠，盡與諸賢，當與我等共相娛樂，莫令閻浮洲商人南行，乃至於夢。』
translation: Here in this most wonderful place of ultimate bliss are gardens, baths, sitting and sleeping places, and groves of trees, where there's a lot of wealth, gold and silver, water spirits, lapis lazuli, maṇi, genuine pearls, jasper, white gold, chariot, coral, tiger pearl, coral, horse agate, jackass, red stone, and swirling pearls, all of which should be given to you, good men, to entertain us together so that merchants from Jambudvīpa don't travel southward, even in a dream.'

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 我等與彼婦人共相娛樂。
translation: "We entertain ourselves with that woman together.

source_sentence: 我等因共婦人合會，生男或復生女。
translation: As a result of our union with that woman, a boy or another girl was born.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 若彼婦人不聞閻浮洲更有商人在於海中，為摩竭魚王破壞船者，則與我等共相娛樂。
translation: If that woman didn't hear that there were more merchants in Jambudvīpa who destroyed the boat of King Māgāra, then she would have shared our amusement.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 若彼婦人聞閻浮洲更有商人在於海中，為摩竭魚王破壞船者，便食我等，極遭逼迫。
translation: "If those women hear that there are more merchants in the ocean on Jambudvīpa who are destroying the king of the mahogany fish's boats, they'll eat us and be severely persecuted.

source_sentence: 若食人時，有餘髮毛及爪齒者，彼婦人等盡取食之。
translation: If there's any hair, nails, or teeth left when they eat someone, those women will take them and eat them all.

source_sentence: 若食人時，有血渧地，彼婦人等便以手爪掘地深四寸，取而食之。
translation: If there's blood on the ground when they eat someone, those women dig their hands and claws into the ground four inches deep, take it, and eat it.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 當知我等閻浮洲商人本有五百人，於中已噉二百五十，餘有二百五十，今皆在此大鐵城中。
translation: You should know that there were originally 500 of us merchants from Jambudvīpa, of whom 250 have already been devoured and the remaining 250 are now in this great iron city.

source_sentence: 賢者！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 汝莫信彼婦人語，彼非真人，是羅剎鬼耳。」』
translation: Don't believe that woman's words; she's not a real person, she's a Rāṣṭrapāla ghost."

source_sentence: 「於是，閻浮洲諸商人問彼閻浮洲一智慧商人曰：『賢者！
translation: "The merchants of Jambudvīpa then asked a wise merchant on Jambudvīpa, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 不問彼大眾人，諸賢！
translation: Don't ask them about the great mass of people, good men!

source_sentence: 頗有方便令我等及汝等從此安隱度至閻浮洲耶？』
translation: Is there a way for us and you to cross over to Jambudvīpa from here in comfort?'

source_sentence: 閻浮洲一智慧商人答曰：『諸賢！
translation: A wise merchant on Jambudvīpa replied, 'Good men!

source_sentence: 我時脫不如是問也。』
translation: I then liberated myself from asking this question.'

source_sentence: 於是，閻浮洲諸商人語曰：『賢者！
translation: The merchants of Jambudvīpa then said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 還去至本共居婦人處已，伺彼眠時，安徐而起，更竊南行。』
translation: He went back to the woman with whom he was living, waited for her to sleep, got up quietly, and went southward without saying a word.'

source_sentence: 復往至彼大眾人所問曰：『諸賢！
translation: Again, he went to the large crowd and asked, 'Good men!

source_sentence: 頗有方便令我等及汝等從此安隱度至閻浮洲耶？』
translation: Is there a way for us and you to cross over to Jambudvīpa from here in comfort?'

source_sentence: 於是，閻浮洲一智慧商人為諸商人默然而受。
translation: That wise merchant from Jambudvīpa then accepted it in silence for the merchants.

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 商人求財經第二十竟(四千二百七十三字)（一三七）中阿含大品世間經第二十一(第三念誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: The Merchant's Quest for Financial Success (4,273 words) (137) Zhong ahan dapin shiyi jing xxi (3rd recitation) I have heard thus: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「如來自覺世間，亦為他說，如來知世間。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "The Tathāgata himself understands the world and teaches others that the Tathāgata knows the world.

source_sentence: 如來自覺世間習，亦為他說，如來斷世間習。
translation: The Tathāgata understands worldly habits for himself and teaches them for others, saying, 'The Tathāgata stops worldly habits.'

source_sentence: 如來自覺世間滅，亦為他說，如來世間滅作證。
translation: The Tathāgata understands for himself the cessation of the world and teaches others that the Tathāgata realizes the cessation of the world.

source_sentence: 如來自覺世間道跡，亦為他說，如來修世間道跡。
translation: The Tathāgata personally recognizes the steps of the worldly path, and he teaches others that the Tathāgata cultivates the steps of the worldly path.

source_sentence: 若有一切盡普正，有彼一切如來知見覺得。
translation: If everything is completely and universally correct, the Tathāgata knows and sees and perceives that everything exists.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來從昔夜覺無上正盡之覺，至于今日夜，於無餘涅槃界，當取滅訖。
translation: From the Tathāgata's awakening to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the past night until this night, he will attain extinction in the state of nirvāṇa without remainder.

source_sentence: 於其中間，若如來口有所言說，有所應對者，彼一切是真諦，不虛不離於如，亦非顛倒，真諦審實，若說師子者，當如說如來。
translation: If the Tathāgata says anything or responds to anything, it's all true, not false or separate from such, not mistaken, and true and completely genuine, and if he says "lion," he'll thus explain the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來在眾有所講說，謂師子吼，一切世間，天及魔、梵、沙門、梵志，從人至天，如來是梵有，如來至冷有，無煩亦無熱，真諦不虛有。」
translation: The Tathāgata explains to the audience, 'Shizi-roar, that of all the worlds, gods, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, and priests, from humans up to the gods, the Tathāgata is Brahmā's existence, the Tathāgata's ultimate cold existence, without trouble or heat, and the true truth is not false.'

source_sentence: 於是，世尊說此頌曰：「知一切世間，　　出一切世間，　說一切世間，　　一切世如真。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke this verse, "He knows all the world, transcends all the world, speaks about all the world, and makes all the world as it really is.

source_sentence: 彼最上尊雄，　　能解一切縛，　得盡一切業，　　生死悉解脫。
translation: That most honored hero frees all fetters, ends all actions, and liberates completely from birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 是天亦是人，　　若有歸命佛，　稽首禮如來，　　甚深極大海。
translation: If these gods or humans were to give their lives to the Buddha, they would bow their heads in homage to the Tathāgata, whose depths are too great.

source_sentence: 知已亦修敬，　　諸天香音神，　彼亦稽首禮，　　謂隨於死者。
translation: Knowing this, they also cultivate respect, and the gods' fragrant sound spirits also bow down in homage, which is to say that they follow the dead.

source_sentence: 稽首禮智士，　　歸命人之上，　無憂離塵安，　　無礙諸解脫。
translation: They bow their heads to wise men, venerate those above them, become carefree and dust-free, and aren't hindered in their liberation.

source_sentence: 是故當樂禪，　　住遠離極定，　當自作燈明，　　無我必失時。
translation: Therefore, you should enjoy meditation, abide in a concentration that's far removed from the utmost, and make a lamp of your own, for when you lack self, you'll surely lose it.

source_sentence: 失時有憂慼，　　謂墮地獄中。」
translation: When they lose it, they'll have grief, which is called falling into hell."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 世間經第二十一竟(三百九十六字)（一三八）中阿含大品福經第二十二(第三念誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: (396 words) (138) Zhong ahan dapin fuxing jing xxii (Third recitation) I heard this: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「莫畏於福，愛樂意所念。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "Don't be afraid of good fortune, for it's pleasant to think about it.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 福者是說樂。
translation: "The good is said to be pleasant.

source_sentence: 畏於福，不愛樂意所念。
translation: Being afraid of good qualities, they don't long for what they want.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 非福者，是說苦。
translation: What's not good is called suffering.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我憶往昔長夜作福，長夜受報，愛樂意所念。
translation: "I remember a long time ago when I did good deeds and received the rewards of long nights, and I loved what I thought.

source_sentence: 我往昔時七年行慈，七返成敗，不來此世，世敗壞時，生晃昱天，世成立時，來下生空梵宮殿中，於彼梵中，作大梵天，餘處千返作自在天王，三十六返作天帝釋，復無量返作剎利頂生王。
translation: In the past, I practiced kindness for seven years, but I failed seven times and didn't come to this world. When the world failed, I was born in the Ābhāsvara Heaven, and when the world was established, I was born down in the palace of Brahmā, where I became the Mahābrahma Heaven, the Śakra King for the other thousand returns, the Śakra King for the thirty-six returns, and the Śāriputra King for the countless returns.

source_sentence: 「比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千大象，被好乘具，眾寶珓飾，白珠珞覆，于娑賀象王為首。
translation: When I was king of the Zāriputra, there were 84,000 large elephants, decked out in fine riding gear, adorned with jewels and jewelry, and covered with white beads, and they were at the head of the Sāgar elephant king.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千馬，被好乘具，眾寶嚴飾，金銀交絡，[馬*毛]馬王為首。
translation: When I was king of the Zāriputra, there were 84,000 horses that were well mounted, adorned with many treasures, and encrusted with gold and silver, and [horse*hair] horse king was at the head.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千車，四種珓飾，莊以眾好，師子、虎豹斑文之皮織成雜色，種種珓飾，極利疾名樂聲車為首。
translation: When I was king of the Zāriputra, there were 84,000 chariots decorated with four kinds of divining, adorned with a variety of beauties, lionesses, tigers, and leopards whose skins were woven with various colors, and decorated with various kinds of divining, headed by a chariot that was extremely sharp, fast, and famously happy with sound.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千大城，極大富樂，多有人民，拘舍惒提王城為首。
translation: When I was king of the Zāriputra, there were 84,000 large cities that were extremely wealthy and happy and had many people, and the city of Kauśāmbī was the head.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千樓，四種寶樓，金、銀、琉璃及水精，正法殿為首。
translation: When I was king of the bharṣa-deva, there were 84,000 stories, four kinds of jeweled stories, gold, silver, beryl, and water essences, and the hall of the true Dharma was at the head.

source_sentence: 「比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千御座，四種寶座，金、銀、琉璃及水精，敷以氍氀、毾[毯-炎+登]，覆以錦綺羅縠，有儭體被，兩頭安枕，加陵伽波惒羅、波遮悉哆羅那。
translation: When I was king of the bharṣa-deva, I had 84,000 royal seats, four kinds of jeweled seats of gold, silver, beryl, and aqua, covered with carpets and coats [blankets-yang+deng], covered with brocade and gauze, with a generous body covering, and with pillows at both ends, and with Kālôngapāla and Pācāśasītāra.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千雙衣，有初摩衣，有錦繒衣，有劫貝衣，有加陵伽波惒羅衣。
translation: When I was king of the buddha-relics, there were 84,000 pairs of robes, including a first-mother robe, a silken-skin robe, a karpāsa robe, and a kalaviṅka robe.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千女，身體光澤，皦潔明淨，美色過人，小不及天，恣容端正，覩者歡悅，眾寶瓔珞嚴飾具足，盡剎利種女，餘族無量。
translation: When I was king of the Zāriputra, there were 84,000 women with radiant bodies, sparkling cleanliness, beauty surpassing that of humans and not as beautiful as that of gods, whose appearance was correct and whose appearance was pleasing to those who saw them, and who were adorned with many treasures and jewelry, ending with the Zāriputra lineage of women and countless others.

source_sentence: 「比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 我作剎利頂生王時，有八萬四千種食，晝夜常供，為我故設，欲令我食。
translation: When I was king of the buddhas, there were 84,000 kinds of food that I always offered day and night, which were set aside for my sake and intended to make me eat.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千種食中，有一種食，極美淨潔，無量種味，是我常所食。
translation: Of those 84,000 kinds of food, there's one food that's perfectly beautiful and pure, with measureless flavors, that I always eat.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千女中，有一剎利女，最端正姝妙，常奉侍我。
translation: Among those 84,000 women, there's one Zāriputra, the most beautiful and handsome, who always serves me.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千雙衣中，有一雙衣，或初摩衣，或錦繒衣，或劫貝衣，或加陵伽波惒邏衣，是我常所著。
translation: Of those 84,000 pairs of clothing, there's one pair of clothing, whether it's a first-skin robe, a silken robe, a karpāsa robe, or a kalaviṅka robe, that I always wear.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千御座中，有一御座，或金或銀，或琉璃，或水精，敷以氍氀、毾[毯-炎+登]，覆以錦綺羅縠，有儭體被，兩頭安枕，加陵伽波惒邏、波遮悉哆邏那，是我常所臥。
translation: One of those 84,000 royal seats is a royal seat, whether of gold or silver, lapis lazuli, or aqua regia, covered with carpets and coarse [blankets-yang+deng], covered with brocade and gauze, with a generous body covering, and with a pillow at each end, which I always lay on, Kālôngapālôdana or Pācasīttarôdana.

source_sentence: 「比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千樓觀中，有一樓觀，或金或銀，或琉璃，或水精，名正法殿，是我常所住。
translation: Among those 84,000 mansions of contemplation, there's one that's either gold, silver, lapis lazuli, or water essence, which is called the hall of the true Dharma and is always occupied by me.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千大城中，有一城極大富樂，多有人民，名拘舍惒提，是我常所居。
translation: Of those 84,000 great cities, there's one that's extremely wealthy and prosperous, with a large population named Kauśāmbṛta, which is my usual residence.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千車中而有一車，莊以眾好，師子、虎豹斑文之皮織成雜色，種種莊飾，極利疾名樂聲車，是我常所載，至觀望園觀。
translation: "Among those 84,000 chariots is one that's adorned with a variety of beauties, lion's and tiger leopard skins woven together in a variety of colors, and decorated in a variety of ways, which is extremely profitable, fast, well-known, and musical, and which I always carry to look around the park and observe.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千馬中而有一馬，體紺青色，頭像如烏，名[馬*毛]馬王，是我常所騎，至觀望園觀。
translation: One of those 84,000 horses has a violet-blue body and a head like a crow, and it's called [Horse*Mao] Horse King, which I always ride and look at from the observation park.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼八萬四千大象中而有一象，舉體極白，七支盡正，名于娑賀象王，是我常所乘，至觀望園觀。
translation: One of those 84,000 elephants has a perfectly white body and seven correct limbs, and it's called the Śākya Elephant King, which is my constant vehicle and goes to look around the Watchtower Park.

source_sentence: 「比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 我作此念：『是何業果，為何業報，令我今日有大如意足，有大威德，有大福祐，有大威神？』
translation: I thought, 'What are the results of actions and the rewards of actions that have caused me to have great miraculous abilities, great virtue, great fortune, and great authority today?'

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 我復作此念：『是三業果，為三業報，令我今日有大如意足，有大威德，有大福祐，有大威神。
translation: Again, I think, 'These are the three results of three actions, which are the rewards of three actions and cause me to have great supernormal abilities, great virtue, great fortune, and great authority today.

source_sentence: 一者布施，二者調御，三者守護。』」
translation: One is generous, two are disciplined, and three are guarded.'"

source_sentence: 於是，世尊說此頌曰：「觀此福之報，　　妙善多饒益，　比丘我在昔，　　七年修慈心。
translation: Thereupon, the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "Observing the rewards of this merit, which are so wonderful and so beneficial, a monk and I used to cultivate kindness for seven years.

source_sentence: 七反成敗劫，　　不來還此世，　世間敗壞時，　　生於晃昱天。
translation: When the world decayed, he was born in the Ābhāsvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 世間轉成時，　　生於梵天中，　在梵為大梵，　　千生自在天。
translation: When the world turns into something, he's born in one of the Brahma heavens, where he's Brahmā, or the Thousand Born-Alone Heaven.

source_sentence: 三十六為釋，　　無量百頂王，　剎利頂生王，　　為人之最尊。
translation: There are 36 interpreters, measureless hundreds of pinnacle kings, and the top-born king of the bhadras, who is the most honored of humans.

source_sentence: 如法非刀杖，　　政御於天下，　如法不加抂，　　正安樂教授。
translation: As the Dharma is not a sword, he rules the world, as the Dharma is not blamed, and he teaches with righteousness and happiness.

source_sentence: 如法轉相傳，　　遍一切大地，　大富多錢財，　　生於如是族。
translation: As the Dharma is transmitted from hand to hand, it pervades the whole earth, and great wealth and possessions are produced in such a clan.

source_sentence: 財穀具足滿，　　成就七寶珍，　因此大福祐，　　所生得自在。
translation: Their wealth and provisions are complete, and they attain the treasures of seven treasures, which bring great fortune and enable them to be born with ease.

source_sentence: 諸佛御於世，　　彼佛之所說，　知此甚奇特，　　見神通不少。
translation: The buddhas have ruled the world, and they've taught us to know this very well and to see miraculous abilities in abundance.

source_sentence: 誰知而不信，　　如是生於冥，　是故當自為，　　欲求大福祐，　當恭敬於法，　　常念佛法律。」
translation: Who knows but doesn't believe that they're thus born in the dark? Therefore, they must make it their own. If they want great fortune, they must respect the Dharma and always remember the Buddha's law."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 福經第二十二竟(一千一百五十四字)（一三九）中阿含大品息止道經第二十三(第三念誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: End of the Twenty-second Section of the Sutra on Blessings (1,154 words) (139) Zhong ahan dapin xizhi dao jing 23 (Third recitation) Here's what I heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「年少比丘始成就戒，當以數數詣息止道觀相，骨相、青相、腐相、食相、骨鏁相。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "When a young monk first accomplishes the precepts, he should repeatedly visit the Way of Calming and observe the marks of bones, green marks, rotten marks, food marks, and bone formation marks.

source_sentence: 彼善受善持此相已，還至住處，澡洗手足，敷尼師檀，在於床上結加趺坐，即念此相，骨相、青相、腐相、食相、骨鏁相。
translation: After he well-acquires and well-maintains this aspect, he goes back to his dwelling, washes his hands and feet, spreads out his sitting mat, sits cross-legged on his bed, and remembers this aspect, which is the aspect of bones, the aspect of green, the aspect of decay, the aspect of food, and the aspect of bones in a cage.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若彼比丘修習此相，速除心中欲恚之病。」
translation: If that monk cultivates this characteristic, he'll quickly rid his mind of the disease of desire and ill-will."

source_sentence: 於是，世尊說此頌曰：「若年少比丘，　　覺未得上意，　當詣息止道，　　欲除其婬欲。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke this verse, "Suppose a young monk who has yet to attain the higher intention awakens and goes on the path of calming down, wanting to remove his sexual desires.

source_sentence: 心中無恚諍，　　慈愍於眾生，　遍滿一切方，　　往至觀諸身。
translation: Without anger or disputation in his mind, he has compassion for sentient beings, pervades all directions, and goes to examine their bodies.

source_sentence: 當觀於青相，　　及以爛腐壞，　觀鳥蟲所食，　　骨骨節相連。
translation: He'll examine their greenish appearance, their decay, the bones that are eaten by birds and insects, and the bones that are connected to their joints.

source_sentence: 修習如是相，　　還歸至本處，　澡洗於手足，　　敷床正基坐。
translation: Cultivating such appearances, he returns to his original place, washes his hands and feet, and spreads out his bed to sit correctly on its foundation.

source_sentence: 當以觀真實，　　內身及外身，　盛滿大小便，　　心腎肝肺等。
translation: He should observe the true, internal and external bodies, which are full of urine and defecation, and his heart, kidneys, liver, and lungs.

source_sentence: 若欲分衛食，　　到人村邑間，　如將鎧纏絡，　　常正念在前。
translation: If he wants to share a meal with someone, he goes to a village or town, wrapping his armor around him like a fetter, and always keeps correct mindfulness in front of him.

source_sentence: 若見色可愛，　　清淨欲相應，　見已觀如真，　　正念佛法律。
translation: If he sees desirable form and pure desires associated with it, he observes it as it really is after seeing it and correctly recollects the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 此中無骨筋，　　無肉亦無血，　無腎心肝肺，　　無有涕唾腦。
translation: There are no bones or tendons, no flesh or blood, no kidneys, heart, liver, lungs, or tears, saliva, or brains.

source_sentence: 一切地皆空，　　水種亦復然，　空一切火種，　　風種亦復空。
translation: All floors are empty, as are the seeds of water, all fire seeds are empty, and the seeds of wind are also empty.

source_sentence: 若所有諸覺，　　清淨欲相應，　彼一切息止，　　如慧之所觀。
translation: If all awakenings are associated with pure desires, they are all calmed, as wisdom observes.

source_sentence: 如是行精懃，　　常念不淨想，　永斷婬怒癡，　　除一切無明，　興起清淨明，　　比丘得苦邊。」
translation: Such is the diligence of practice, constant mindfulness of impure thoughts, permanent cessation of lust, anger, and delusion, removal of all ignorance, and the arising of pure insight that brings a monk to the limit of suffering."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 息止道經第二十三竟(三百七十二字)（一四〇）中阿含大品至邊經第二十四(第三念誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Xiqie dao jing x23 ing (372 words) (140) Zhong ahan dapin zhibian jing x24 (Third recitation) Here's what I heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「於生活中下極至邊，謂行乞食。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "In life, the lowest to the highest limit is called practicing begging for food.

source_sentence: 世間大諱，謂為禿頭手擎鉢行，彼族姓子為義故受。
translation: It's a big taboo in the world to say that you're walking around bald with a bowl in your hand, but that clansman accepts it for its own sake.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以厭患生老病死、愁慼啼哭、憂苦懊惱，或得此淳具足大苦陰邊，汝等非如是心出家學道耶？」
translation: Are you not thus minded to leave home and train on the path because you're tired of suffering birth, old age, illness, death, sorrow and lamentation, grief and vexation, or attaining the limit of the great aggregate of suffering in this simple form?"

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白曰：「如是。」
translation: The monks then said, "So it is."

source_sentence: 世尊復告諸比丘曰：「彼愚癡人以如是心出家學道，而行伺欲染著至重，濁纏心中，憎嫉無信，懈怠失正念，無正定，惡慧心狂，調亂諸根，持戒極寬，不修沙門，不增廣行。
translation: The Bhagavān again addressed the monks, "With this kind of mind, that foolish man leaves home and trains on the path, but he acts with the heaviest defilement of desire, ties his mind with hatred and envy, loses right mindfulness with laziness, lacks right concentration, is crazy with bad wisdom, disturbs his faculties, observes the precepts very leniently, doesn't cultivate asceticism, and doesn't increase his extensive practice.

source_sentence: 猶人以墨浣墨所污，以血除血，以垢除垢，以濁除濁，以廁除廁，但增其穢。
translation: They're like a person who coats what's stained by ink, removes blood with blood, removes dirt with dirt, removes impurity with impurity, and removes toilet with toilet, but only adds to their defilement.

source_sentence: 從冥入冥，從闇入闇，我說彼愚癡人持沙門戒亦復如是。
translation: Going from darkness into darkness and from darkness into darkness, I say this is likewise for that foolish man who observes the ascetic precepts.

source_sentence: 謂彼人伺欲染著至重，濁纏心中，憎嫉無信，懈怠失正念，無正定，惡慧心狂，調亂諸根，持戒極寬，不修沙門，不增廣行。
translation: That person's desire-seeking defilement is so great that it ties up his mind with impurity, he hates and resents it without faith, is lazy and lacks right mindfulness, lacks right concentration, has bad wisdom and a crazy mind, disturbs his faculties, observes the precepts with extreme leniency, doesn't cultivate asceticism, and doesn't increase his extensive practice.

source_sentence: 猶無事處燒人殘木，彼火燼者，非無事所用，亦非村邑所用，我說彼愚癡人持沙門戒亦復如是。
translation: Like the leftover wood of a man burned at an office without a fire, which is not used for nothing and isn't used by a village, I say this foolish man observing the ascetic precepts will be likewise.

source_sentence: 謂彼人行伺欲染著至重，濁纏心中，憎嫉無信，懈怠失正念，無正定，惡慧心狂，調亂諸根，持戒極寬，不修沙門，不增廣行。」
translation: That person engages in desiring and defiled attachment that's so heavy it ties up their mind, hates and resents them without faith, is lazy and lacks right mindfulness, lacks right concentration, has bad wisdom and a crazy mind, disturbs their faculties, observes the precepts very leniently, doesn't cultivate asceticism, and doesn't increase their extensive practice."

source_sentence: 於是，世尊說此頌曰：「愚癡失欲樂，　　復失沙門義，　俱忘失二邊，　　猶燒殘火燼。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke this verse, "Foolishly losing their desires and pleasures and also losing the meaning of asceticism, they both forget and lose the two extremes, just as they burn a scorching fire.

source_sentence: 猶如無事處，　　燒人殘火燼，　無事村不用。
translation: They're like the embers of a person's residual fire that burns up without an office, and they don't use it for anything.

source_sentence: 人著欲亦然，　猶燒殘火燼，　　俱忘失二邊。」
translation: Similarly, a person attached to desire is like burning the embers of a stubborn fire, forgetting both sides."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 至邊經第二十四竟(四百二十二字)（一四一）中阿含大品喻經第二十五(第三念誦)我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Zhibian jing xxiv ing (422 words) (141) Zhong ahan dapin yuqie jing xxv (3rd recitation) Here's what I heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「若有無量善法可得，彼一切以不放逸為本，不放逸為習，因不放逸生，不放逸為首；不放逸者，於諸善法為最第一。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If there were measureless good qualities to attain, they would all be based on nonconcentration, cultivated by nonconcentration, produced by nonconcentration, and headed by nonconcentration; that nonconcentration is the most important of the good qualities.

source_sentence: 猶作田業，彼一切因地、依地、立地，得作田業。
translation: They're like creating a field, which all cause, rely on, and establish a field to create work.

source_sentence: 如是若有無量善法可得，彼一切以不放逸為本，不放逸為習，因不放逸生，不放逸為首；不放逸者，於諸善法為最第一。
translation: Thus, if there are measureless good qualities to attain, they all have nonconcentration as their basis, nonconcentration as their habituation, nonconcentration as their cause and nonconcentration as their leader, and nonconcentration is the best of the good qualities.

source_sentence: 猶種子，村及與鬼村，百穀藥木得生長養，彼一切因地、依地、立地，得生長養。
translation: Like seeds that grow and nourish a village or a ghost village with a hundred grains and medicinal plants, they all grow and nourish by virtue of, depending on, and standing on the ground.

source_sentence: 「如是，若有無量善法可得，彼一切以不放逸為本，不放逸為習，因不放逸生，不放逸為首；不放逸者，於諸善法為最第一。
translation: "Thus, if there are measureless good qualities to attain, they are all based on nonconcentration, cultivated by nonconcentration, produced by nonconcentration, and headed by nonconcentration, and that nonconcentration is the most important of the good qualities.

source_sentence: 猶諸根香，沈香為第一。
translation: He's like the scent of roots, in which the scent of silt is the first.

source_sentence: 猶諸樹香，赤栴檀為第一。
translation: It's like the scent of trees, with red sandalwood being the first.

source_sentence: 猶諸水華，青蓮華為第一。
translation: It's like the watery lotus, with the blue lotus being the first.

source_sentence: 猶諸陸華，須摩那華為第一。
translation: It's like the landflower, with the sumac flower being the first.

source_sentence: 猶諸獸跡，彼一切悉入象跡中，象跡盡攝，彼象跡者為最第一，謂廣大故。
translation: Like the tracks of animals, they all enter the elephant tracks, which are completely included, and that elephant track is the greatest, meaning it's vast.

source_sentence: 如是，若有無量善法可得，彼一切以不放逸為本，不放逸為習，因不放逸生，不放逸為首；不放逸者，於諸善法為最第一。
translation: Thus, if there are measureless good qualities to attain, they are all based on nonconcentration, which is cultivated by nonconcentration and arises from nonconcentration, and nonconcentration is the first; that nonconcentration is the most important of the good qualities.

source_sentence: 猶諸獸中，彼師子王為最第一。
translation: He's like the lion king who's the best among animals.

source_sentence: 猶如列陣共鬪戰時，唯要誓為第一。
translation: It's like when they're fighting in battle, only the vow to be the best is honored.

source_sentence: 猶樓觀椽，彼一切皆依承椽梁立，承椽梁、承椽梁皆攝持之，承椽梁者為最第一，謂盡攝故。
translation: It's like a mansion observing rafters, where everything is built on rafter beams, and the rafter beams and rafter beams are all included, so the one who bears the rafter beams is the best, which means it's completely included.

source_sentence: 「如是，若有無量善法可得，彼一切以不放逸為本，不放逸為習，因不放逸生，不放逸為首；不放逸者，於諸善法為最第一。
translation: "Thus, if there are measureless good qualities to attain, they are all based on nonconcentration, which is cultivated because of nonconcentration, and nonconcentration is the first, and that nonconcentration is the most important of the good qualities.

source_sentence: 猶如諸山，須彌山王為第一。
translation: He's like a mountain, and Sumeru the king of mountains is the best.

source_sentence: 猶如諸泉，大泉攝水，大海為第一。
translation: It's like the springs, of which the ocean is the greatest when it collects water from a large spring.

source_sentence: 猶諸大身，阿須羅王為第一。
translation: He's like the great body, with King Asura as the leader.

source_sentence: 猶諸瞻侍，魔王為第一。
translation: It's like the attendants, with Māra King as the first.

source_sentence: 猶諸行欲，頂生王為第一。
translation: He's like all the karmic desires, and the king of peak birth is the best.

source_sentence: 猶如諸小王，轉輪王為第一。
translation: He's like the lesser kings, with the wheel-turning king as the first.

source_sentence: 猶如虛空諸星，宿月殿為第一。
translation: He's like the stars of the sky, with the moon-dwelling king as number one.

source_sentence: 猶諸綵衣，白練為第一。
translation: He's like all the colored robes, with the white linen being the best.

source_sentence: 猶諸光明，慧光明為第一。
translation: It's like all the lights, with the light of wisdom being the first.

source_sentence: 猶如諸眾，如來弟子眾第一。
translation: It's like the multitude of people, with the disciples of the Tathāgata being the most numerous.

source_sentence: 猶如諸法，有為及無為，愛盡、無欲、滅盡、涅槃為第一。
translation: Just like all things, whether existent or inactive, the end of craving, lack of desire, cessation, and nirvāṇa are the best.

source_sentence: 猶諸眾生，無足、二足、四足、多足，色、無色、有想、無想，乃至非有想非無想，如來於彼為極第一，為大為上，為最為勝，為尊為妙。
translation: It's like all living beings, whether legless, two-legged, four-legged, or many-legged, with form, formless, with or without perception, or even without perception or without perception, in which the Tathāgata is the very best, great, superior, most excellent, and honored as marvelous.

source_sentence: 猶如因牛有乳，因乳有酪，因酪有生酥，因生酥有熟酥，因熟酥有酥精，酥精為第一，為大為上，為最為勝，為尊為妙。
translation: It's like when there's milk because of the cow, cream because of milk, butter because of cream, refined butter because of butter, and ghee because of refined butter, and ghee is the best, great, higher, most excellent, honored, and marvelous.

source_sentence: 如是若有諸眾生，無足、二足、四足、多足，色、無色、有想、無想，乃至非有想非無想，如來於彼為極第一，為大為上，為最為勝，為尊為妙。」
translation: Thus, if there are beings who are legless, two-legged, four-legged, or many-legged, with form, formless, with or without perception, or even without perception or without perception, the Tathāgata is the very best of them all, great and higher, most excellent, and honored and marvelous."

source_sentence: 於是，世尊說此頌曰：「若有求財物，　　極好轉增多，　稱譽不放逸，　　事無事慧說。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke this verse, "If someone seeks possessions that are excellent and increase in number, they're praised as not being careless and their affairs are explained by wisdom.

source_sentence: 有不放逸者，　　必取二俱義，　即此世能獲，　　後世亦復得，　雄猛觀諸義，　　慧者必解脫。」
translation: Those who aren't careless will surely grasp both their meanings, even if they can obtain them in this life and also in the next, and they will vigorously contemplate their meanings, and the wise will surely be liberated."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 喻經第二十五竟(七百七十一字)
translation: End of the Twenty-Five Part Discourse on the Parables (771 words)

source_sentence: 中阿含經卷第三十四(七千三百八十八字)中阿含經大品第一竟(五萬三百六十九字)
translation: Middle Length Āgama Sutras, Volume 34 (7,388 words) 中阿含經大品第一名終 (50,369 words)
